name: Burn Down R&D
description:
This deck is to apply earlier pressure with Darwin and defeat cheap ice. Parasite knock down anything bigger. The real point of the deck is to set up Data Leak Reversal with Fall Guy protection and then tag yourself with John Masanori.

The Sacrificial Construct is to protect Djinns while face checking ice. I had Crypsis in but i replaced them with Corroder to deal with Wraparounds. The Sacrificial Construct worked as extra clicks for Crypsis, especially with Fall Guy.

I need to put in Joshua B. but I'm not sure what to take out to put him in. Maybe replace the two Scavenge with an Account Siphon and drop one Déjà Vu to put two Joshua B. in.

name: Building Walls
description:
This deck is to gear check the runner and block him from having any successful runs. Power Shutdown, Archer, and Swarm remove programs and every other piece of ice ends the run.

There is actually a nice fast advance system built in if you can get some extra clicks on a Project Atlas. Trick of Light can be used recursively with Jackson Howard and Project Atlas tokens. Ideally, you are advancing ice every turn. For Commercialization and Trick of Light.

Possible edits include adding Witness Tampering or Veterans Program to deal with the bad publicity that builds up from Swarm, Hostile Takeover and Geothermal Fracking. My thought is to leave the bad pub there as they shouldn't have the gear to break the ice, so the bad publicity credits don't matter.

Suggested edits are always welcome.

name: You shall not pass!
description: This is a experimental "Because We Built It" deck based on gigantic ice, massive amounts of money and good, old standard advancing. There are no extreme combos, but a lot of snyergies with Simone, Matrix and Commercialization. Comments well appreciated.

name: TWIY AstroBiotics
description: My version of the popular TWIY AstroBiotics.

name: Prepaid Faerush
description:
Long ago when PPVP came out I ran this style of deck and found it to be pretty great, but it lost to some of the more flexible weyland decks, so I shelved it.

With Lucky find and Legwork, I think the deck is ripe again. I've been running this on and off with Anatomy of Anarchy and it does serious work, especially against Jinteki. When you remove the threat of sentries, and have Deus X you're nearly impervious to the treacheries that are Jinteki, (besides RP).

I feel like you can slot -1 legwork and +1 Lucky Find if econ runs light. The deal is to draw aggressively and run very fast, use tinkering to get in ASAP for maker's eyes and Legworks. I'd like to see 3 tinkerings, but with Same Old thing, it might not be totally necessary.

1 plascrete is kinda scary with scorched imaging being a thing, but honestly moneying up and attacking fast should be able to save you from that.

name: Jinteki RP Annoyance
Noise R&D destroyer
description:
This deck is a mill deck, plain and simple: just mill and wait. You can mill 15 cards for sure, in 9/10 turn if you keep draw, install on scheherazade and pawn, mostly with a credit gain. At this poit with 5 initial draw + 9 cards + 15 cards milled, there should be around 30/49 cards in play, and at least 20 cards in the archive.

No run until you gave corp a bad pub with activist support (use new angeles city hall to avoid the tag). Don't worry if the corp get richer and richer: you can always blackmail her.

Econ is scheherazade + virus (with max 3 cost) + pawnshop (that gaves you 3 cred). Draw motor is wyldside.

Try it and have fun to see when you succeed.

name: No Cyperspace for Old Man v2.0
description:
Second incarnation of my Iain deck that is trying to maximize income from Underworld Contacts. I've changed the breaker suite around a bit, mainly for the Cloud subtype Zu. Since he doesn't take MU, I will have enough for all my breakers and Sneakdoor with just Logos out. Mem Chips were replaced with Access to Globalsec, just the Underworld Contacts active for 2 fewer credits.

In addition to this, I added the clone chips as a backup against program destruction, and The Source to help me get a few more turns of Underworld income in.

I got rid of the connections income event because I rarely had more than 3 in play, so I just went with Easy Mark for more reliable +3c. I also added two inside jobs and removed 1 special order (either I will draw into a breaker already or Logos can fetch one).

I'll be play testing this later today, so I'll come back with some results... hopefully manages better against Jinteki and FA strategies.

name: Oracle Kate PsyCaffrey
description:
This is the third version of my Oracle May / Motivation / Chakana deck, and as someone who's been playing it compusively on OCTGN for weeks, let me tell you: it's a beast once you get the hang of it.

Build Up, Run Poor

Daily Casts / Underworld Contact make for a solid clickless economy, usually netting 2-4 free credits a turn, plus the Oracle May draw means you're often at 6-8 credits (+2 recurring from The Toolbox) from 0 with three clicks left once you're set up. Coupled with lots of tools to get at least one of those engines up and running early, this deck can afford to run itself down to zero at the end of each turn once it's into phase 3.

Run Light, Break Shit

The obvious answer to that is 'Okay, but what about the early game? How do you deal with FA decks?' That is what Chakana and the Parasite / Datasucker combo was born to do. Use your sucker tokens, parasites and clone chips to expose the centrals to repeated hits, keeping the corp in phase 1 while you steadily clock Chakana tokens and Indexings, The Maker's Eyes and (at the very least) random accesses.

Here's a horrible secret: Chakana is far more terrifying than it is actually threatening. If you get one on the board when the corp is starting to set up an early scoring remote, they almost always immediately abandon all plans and start icing R&D. Take this opportunity to hit HQ a few times for sucker tokens / accesses, then switch back and forth as necessary. If you get Chakana running, take the inevitable virus clear as a sign to start hitting HQ, or to build up to hit the underprepared remote. Best case scenario, they try to soldier on despite Chakana and weigh down their entire

Specific Card Choices

The Toolbox: I know it's an unpopular choice, but it rolls three things this deck desperately needs together into two card slots: links, MU, and recurring credits. Modded is primarily there to help get The Toolbox out for 5c with Kate's ability, and even if you don't see them both together, you usually have plenty of cash in this deck to get it on the table.

ZU.13 Key Master: It's cheap, it's got good synergy with the links in the deck, and it's versatile. That said, it's also expensive to run, vulnerable to power shutdown and sketchy against high-strength code gates. Despite that, its cheapness is definitely worth it with the current prevalence of Inazuma-based kill decks, as you can SMC into it and break the subroutine allowing you to jack out for 7c (with Kate's ability) vs 9c for Gordian Blade. That's not much, but against a kill deck it's important.

Motivation / Oracle May: I really can't stress enough how good this draw engine is once it gets running. Costing only 1c & two clicks (3 with Hostage) to get going, you make your money back fast and it gets you through phase 2 quicker than most corps are expecting. Oracle May also has obvious synergy with Test Run, and since you want to play her as soon as you see her in most cases, this gets your rig running quick.

Clone Chip: Hail mary MVP for facechecking towards the end of phase 1. Honestly, I feel like any parasite deck ought to be running three of these by default, as installing parasites on the fly is incredibly useful and will save your skin multiple times. If I can get 2 datasuckers up quickly, I'll hit Archives 3 times (because it's so rare to see any meaty protection on there vs. Shaper) and then facecheck any ice on the table.

Indexing: We all know Indexing into Maker's Eye wins games, but even beyond that, it has great synergy with Chakana and the slowdown game generally. Be prepared to hide agendas two or three deep and then count the draws to know when they're on top or in HQ. Corps often assume that if you don't immediately hit R&D after Indexing that you saw nothing but ice and operations; make them pay for that by setting up to steal an NAPD in three turns rather than immediately.

Problems

  • This deck requires you to be concentrating at all times. There are usually five or six different ways to approach any game state, and all of them require a bit of planning, maths and forethought. That's hella tiring, so taking this to a tournament might mean you're too knackered to play right by the end of the day.
  • You can't wear tags. Like, at all. Be wary of Midseasons and other tricks.
  • If they manage to trash Oracle May with net damage or something, you have to Levy to get her back. You can go on without her of course, but where's the fun in that? Better to install her ASAP when she hits your hand.
  • Getting stuck on one server = death. You've got to be ready to stick and move at all times, keeping up steady pressure on remotes and centrals so they don't know what you're up to. The biggest cause of losses with this deck, in my experience, comes from trying too hard to load Chakana or check a particular remote rather than consider other options.

Anyway! The most important thing is this deck is incredibly fun to play and I honestly think learning its ins and outs has made me a much better player. Hope y'all dig it. :)

name: HB Brain Damage-amage-amage
description: Just trying out a brain damage HB based on another deck, don't have 3 Neural EMP's though. Put in an Edge of the World.

name: Noisy Demolition
description:
From Anatomy of Anarch but focusing a little more on virus pressure and using Planned Assault to either get a huge Demolition Run run with Medium or Nerve Agent. I like demo run here because it hits combo pieces and economy cards, can dump a whole bunch of agendas in archives and can be tutored out with Planned Assault at an opportune time.

Possible changes I am debating,

  1. Remove the Datasuckers for Imps to try to trash key cards sooner.
  2. Swap Grimoire's to Deep Red and play Overmind

I would greatly appreciate feedback and advice!

name: The Medtech 6
description:
This deck is based off of Team Covenant's Tim Bunn's article about the 6 agenda Medtech which can be found on their website.

This deck is tough to beat. But once you understand that IAA means agenda, well you know you have a window.

With that in mind, I needed to add some form of card that I can IAA and force the runner's hand at times.

The idea is that this deck doesn't struggle for econ, so take out some minor econ to include the trap. The econ I swapped out may need adjusting, but seems solid at this point.

NOTE: Edge of World should be Project Junebug

name: nasir concept deck
description:
just foolin' around with a dagger + paintbrush deck. MO is for the late game once stuff is rezzed. dagger as primary icebreaker bc sentries are scary. recurring credits to feed the dagger safely.

idk!

name: The Medtech 6
description:
This deck is based off of Team Covenant's Tim Bunn's article about the 6 agenda Medtech deck.

This deck is tough to beat. But once you understand that IAA means agenda, well you know you have a window.

With that in mind, I needed to add some form of card that I can IAA and force the runner's hand at times.

The idea is that this deck doesn't struggle for econ, so take out some minor econ to include the trap. The econ I swapped out may need adjusting, but seems solid at this point.

name: Sonique le Runhog (cloak n swagger version)
Trickster
NBN first attempt *work in progress*
Reconstructor lock
description:
Drawing inspiration from @pandapersona's build I thought I'd try what I would do. Purely atman based, that way you can run atman at whatever strength their ice on R&D is, so you can run with impunity. Parasite to destroy ice to keep costs down and remove swordsman.

Aesops economy with Daily Casts and armitage (last tick aesop's) and spare record reconstructors. Light on events so you can spend all your time running (draw when needed).

Not sure if CS MC is needed, maybe just akamatsu.

name: NBN first attempt *work in progress*
The Express delievers
description:
I really like criminals, especially the high impact event-based strategy. So i was excited to play with Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone when it came out. Not only you get 17 influence which is huge, you also get rewarded for playing run events.

So my starting point was the idea, to run Planned Assault with a lot of different run events, so that i had access to all of them while not having to play all of them as 3 of's.

To go with that Account Siphon, Dirty Laundry, Indexing and Inside Job are easy inclusions. I think Indexing is much better early, while The Maker's Eye can do some work in the late game since you only need to run once to see 3 cards. I also really like the other one-of's in Legwork and Stimhack.

With bigger ICE coming back, i think Emergency Shutdown becomes a lot better, so i chose to play at least one, which can be used again if needed.

Since running all the time is part of the plan, Desperado is a natural fit. Since i don't aim to score Notoriety or Quest Completed, it should be much better than Doppelgänger. On top of that, i started with 3 Security Testing and the first one turned out to be amazing. Since the second and third one are almost dead cards (they don't stack on a single server), i cut one of those. John Masanori does great work here, because you need to draw cards, but you don't want to spend clicks to do it, so here is another perfect card for the deck.

And with all the amazing events, 3 Same Old Thing is a No-Brainer. It's worth noting, that Same Old Thing makes every one-of better, because you can play it again from your heap.

All the important run events are pretty cheap so i don't feel the need to run any hardware, that pays for events (Prepaid VoicePAD or Public Terminal). I actually started without Sure Gamble in the first place, because i wanted to test a run-only economy. I realised though that sometimes, you just need the burst economy to get going.

Concerning the breaker suite i felt like i needed efficient breakers, so i decided to go for an old-fashioned anarch breaker suite with Datasucker, which also fits the plan to always run. Faerie and Deus X were my choices for early game pressure, so that i can run without being afraid of any ICE. Since i don't want to spend to many slots on breakers, 3 Special Order is the way to go and Clone Chip makes sure, you don't lose because a breaker was trashed or lost to net damage. In addition, it works really well with Stimhack.

The last card added was actually the Crash Space which seems to be a better Plascrete Carapace in this deck, since it can remove tags after a Account Siphon and can help against a SEA Source, Scorched Earth, Scorched Earth turn by the corp. I really don't like being passive with this deck. :)

name: All-In Turnabout
description: Trying out a combo. No comments please.

name: Tag Me All Night Long
Accelerated Advance
An Anarch's Milieu
Fracking, Fragging & Advancing
description:
This is the first Corp deck I've built mostly from the ground up that just feels ~right~. The goal of the deck is to have a variety of ways to win the game, rather than just one strategy that will get rock, paper scissored out after a game or two in your meta.

The strength is in its ability to use the high amount of operations cards to build an economy quickly, get out a strong Hadrians Wall or Curtain Wall to protect your early game agendas and advance with impunity. In the mid game the deck accels at killing the runner with Punitive Strike + SEA Source and + Scorched Earth combos. Even if the runner has Plascrete out, they will at least have to be prepared to grab a big point agenda and protect themselves.

I've found that it's really important to be careful with with ICE you rez, insofar as you want to have a war chest to spend on the SEA Source and the Punitive. The goal of the deck is to wave all those creds around with impunity. When things get tight use Geothermal Fracking to get out more creds and then clear your bad publicity with Witness Tampering.

name: Kill or Trash? (V1.0)
description:
Very experimental tryout here.

This deck focuses on a Midseason Replacements and Psychographics combo using it to score either Project Ares or Private Security Force to either flatline the runner through loads of meat damage or Just incapacitate him by trashing everything with Ares.

Fast Track is your tutor once you have the tags and the credits to Psychographics your agenda of choice.

I picked small to medium ICE just to get some out fast and to set an up-hill economic battle by being taxing to the runner.

NAPD Contract could be your bait with an install-advance to make the runner spend more credits and be susceptible to high tagging.

name: Opudromeda
description: carefaul with the corroder lol

name: Katelyn is a PADdict
description: get it baby
